Resources



Sessions:

  1. All Participants Orientation (02/23/2023)

    A general event overview for all persons participating in the Hack the Threat 23 hackathon.
    Topics will include:
      • Team Deliverables
      • Example project timelines
      • Available resources

References:

  • HackHPC.org - http://hackhpc.org
  • HackHPC Past Hackathon Events - http://hackhpc.org/pasthacks/

  • Introduction to GitHub - https://lab.github.com/githubtraining/introduction-to-github
  • Introduction to Version Control - https://swcarpentry.github.io/git-novice/
  • Google Colab - https://colab.research.google.com/

Datasets:

  • HackHPC Datasets - http://hackhpc.org/data

Dashboards:

  • R for Data Science - R for Data Science. Code in R / concepts useful any language - had.co.nz
  • Tidy data for efficiency, reproducibility, and collaboration - openscapes.org
  • Tidy data Paper - Original paper by Hadley Wickham (founder of R) who pioneered the concept of tidy data - https://vita.had.co.nz/papers/tidy-data.pdf
  • Tidy data - informal and example code heavy (in R) version - tidyverse.org
  • Chart Chooser — Juice Analytics - https://www.juiceanalytics.com/chartchooser
  • Plotly graphing library - https://plotly.com/python/
  • Dash App documentation - https://dash.plotly.com/
  • Deploy to Heroku integration from github - https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/github-integration
  • Dash guidance / command line (scroll past Enterprise information to Heroku / free section - https://dash.plotly.com/deployment
